metadata.author: Won Eui Hong
metadata.excerpt: Analysis of AMR's intrinsic value and capital allocation strategy as revealed in the 2025 Q3 10-Q report

metadata.title: AMR: The Mathematical Inevitability of Capital Compression and Financial Stability
metadata.author: Won Eui Hong
metadata.excerpt: Net cash $453M, debt only $5M. AMR is maximizing per-share value through capital compression by repurchasing 42% of shares outstanding. Financial analysis based on 2025 Q3 10-Q disclosure materials.

metadata.title: AMR: Market Concerns and Management's Defense Logic
metadata.author: Won Eui Hong
metadata.excerpt: AMR's low multiple (P/FCF 6.2x) reflects not simply undervaluation but the market's structural fear. This report analyzes three core risks that investors are concerned about and examines how management is defending against them with specific numbers and strategies.

metadata.title: AMR Target Price Valuation: Status Quo Scenario and Capital Efficiency-Based Approach
metadata.author: Won Eui Hong
metadata.excerpt: This report calculates AMR's target price assuming that current revenue realization prices and margin rates remain constant going forward. Through aggressive share repurchases reducing share count, maintaining the status quo itself leads to mechanical per-share value appreciation.

metadata.title: [Investment Thesis] Canadian Natural Resources (CNQ): Asymmetric Opportunity from Low-Cost Structure and Overwhelming Cash Generation
metadata.author: Won Eui Hong
metadata.excerpt: CNQ's investment thesis centers on the combination of downside rigidity based on 'long-life low-decline assets' and upside potential through efficient capital allocation. Q3 2025 results recorded record quarterly production volumes, demonstrating the robustness of the business model.
